text:
(1)
Bowery, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of Rivington Street.  Nos. 211-213 Bowery, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of Rivington Street, are 3-story frame houses.  The Third Ave., Elevated is shown on the Bowery.
1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

(2)
The same, from a different angle, and also showing Rivington Street, south side, east from the Bowery.  Note the Rivington Street Station of the Second Ave., Elevated on Allen Street. (Background).

April 4, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Rivington Street

title: Manhattan: Bowery - Rivington Street

text:
Bowery, at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Rivington Street.
October 12, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Rivington Street

text:
205-203 Bowery, east side, south of Rivington Street. Buildings shown are frame structures, adjoining the Peoples Theatre.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Rivington Street

text:
The Bowery, north from Rivington Street, showing a bread line extending to the Salvation Army Memorial Hotel No. 223½-225 Bowery. See other mounts for further views.

About 1932.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Rivington Street

text:
Bowery, east side, south from (No. 223½-225) a point north of Rivington Street and across same, showing a bread line outside of the Salvation Army Memorial Hotel, No. 223½-225 Bowery. These individuals, destitute and hungry are daily fed here. During the depression the extent of these lines were unbelievable. Several other agencies in this vicinity perform a similar task. This set consists of 3 views photographed the same day.

About 1932.

View 1
View 2: Neg. # 994
View 3
